captions.text:
HEY WHATS UP GUYS IM ALEX FARNHAM AND THIS
IS ANIMALIST NEWS

TAKE A LOOK AT THIS PHOTO OF THIS 160 FOOT LONG GIANT SQUID
PRETTY BIG RIGHT? NOW TAKE A CLOSER LOOK
MMM YEAH THATS TOTALLY FAKE...

THIS PHOTO MADE ITS WAY AROUND THE WEB LAST
WEEK REPORTING

THAT A GIANT SQUID HAD WASHED UP ON SHORE
IN SANTA MONICA.

OBVIOUSLY WHO EVER DID THE PHOTOSHOP WORK
WASN'T A PRO

THIS IS JUST A PHOTO OF PEOPLE STANDING ON THE
BEACH WITH A

CUT OUT BLOWN UP PICTURE OF A 30 FOOT SQUID
THAT
THAT WAS FOUND IN SPAIN LAST OCTOBER! NICE WORK.
NOW LOOK AT THIS PHOTO! THAT MY FRIENDS IS A PICTURE OF A REAL GIANT SQUID!

THIS 13 FOOT GIANT SQUID WAS DISCOVERED TANGLED IN A
FISHERMAN'S NET

OFF THE COAST OF SADO ISLAND IN JAPAN. THE SQUID WAS
STILL ALIVE WHEN THE FISHERMAN FOUND
IT, BUT WHEN HE BROUGHT IT TO THE SURFACE IT DIED. EITHER WAY GUYS IT'S STILL AWESOME AND AMAZING A SQUID THIS SIZE IS SO RARE TO ACTUALLY BE
CAUGHT AND BROUGHT TO LAND!

NOW THIS ISN'T THE FIRST GIANT SQUID EVER
DISCOVERED, THE FIRST LIVE GIANT SQUID EVER DISCOVERED

WAS BACK IN 2006, WHEN SCIENTISTS
FOUND AND CAUGHT A 24 FOOT GIANT SQUID OFF

THE COAST OF JAPAN.
GIANT SQUID ARE ONE OF THE LARGEST INVERTEBRATES

IN THE WORLD
THEY LIVE VERY VERY DEEP IN THE OCEAN.
WHICH IS WHY IT'S SO RARE TO FIND THEM AT THE SURFACE LIKE THIS. ALSO THEY HAVE VERY LARGE FEATURES, INCLUDING THE LARGEST EYE IN THE WHOLE ANIMAL KINGDOM.
THOSE BIG EYES HELP THEM NAVIGATE THE DEEPEST DARKEST PART OF THE OCEAN, AND HELPS THEM SPOT BOTH PREDATORS AND PREY.
SO WHAT DO YOU GUYS THINK ABOUT THESE LARGE HUGE GIANT SQUID?
I PERSONALLY THINK THEY'RE VERY SCARY AND THEY LOOK LIKE ALIENS FROM ANOTHER PLANET. BUT MAYBE YOU GUYS HAVE A DIFFERENT VIEW ON IT.

comments.author: colton eddy

comments.text:
Cephalopods (squids, octopus, etc) are amazing!

They have a multipart brain. The main part is a donut-shaped organ wrapped 
around their esophageous, then there are two visual processing areas 
connected to the two eyes, and then a whole bunch of neurons spread 
throughout their body. If you sever a leg and keep it alive somehow, it 
will grab objects and try to put them in a nonexistent mouth, because each 
leg has enough neurons to plan out complex movements like that. They also 
have amazing colorchanging skin, which unlike chameleons is controlled by 
neurons that can react instantly. Weirdly enough, they are colorblind in 
their eyes, but have light-sensitive cells in their skin, leading some 
researchers to suggest they may have color vision in their skin to control 
their color camouflage.﻿
